description: Cases requiring synthesis of evidence into falsifiable hypotheses with concrete validation plans. Designed to test novel/testable reasoning.

cases.claim: The sharp rise in autoimmune diseases in developed nations since 1980 is primarily caused by reduced childhood microbial exposure
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Autoimmune disease incidence increased 3-9% per year in Western nations 1980-2020; hygiene hypothesis proposes reduced microbial exposure disrupts immune regulation
Children raised on farms with livestock have 50% lower asthma rates; Amish vs Hutterite study shows 4x difference despite genetic similarity
Antibiotic use in first year of life associated with 2x risk of IBD; gut microbiome diversity declining in industrialized populations

cases.claim: Default opt-in organ donation policies cause higher organ donation rates compared to opt-out systems
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Countries with opt-out policies show 25-30% higher registered donor rates but actual transplant rates differ by only 5-8%
Spain (opt-out) leads in transplants but attributes success to transplant coordinator network, not the legal default
Wales switched to opt-out in 2015; deceased donation rates increased 10% but confounded by simultaneous infrastructure investment

cases.claim: Microplastic ingestion is causing measurable reproductive decline in oceanic fish populations
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Lab studies show microplastic exposure reduces fish fertility by 20-40% at concentrations 10-100x higher than current ocean levels
Field surveys detect microplastics in 90% of sampled fish; endocrine-disrupting chemical leaching confirmed but dose-response in wild populations unknown
North Sea herring populations declined 30% since 2005; multiple stressors (overfishing, warming, pollution) confound single-cause attribution

cases.claim: 15-minute city designs reduce carbon emissions more effectively than electric vehicle adoption alone
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Barcelona superblocks pilot reduced car traffic 25% and NOx 25% in intervention areas; displaced traffic partially offset gains in surrounding streets
Life-cycle analysis shows EV adoption reduces transport emissions 50-70% but manufacturing and grid emissions persist; total savings depend on electricity mix
Paris 15-minute city policies correlated with 8% reduction in car trips 2020-2023; cycling infrastructure investment a major confound

cases.claim: Regular bilingual practice delays the onset of Alzheimer's disease by 4-5 years
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Meta-analysis of 20 studies: bilinguals diagnosed with dementia 4.5 years later on average, but selection bias and education confounds not fully controlled
fMRI shows bilinguals have greater cognitive reserve markers (increased prefrontal cortex volume, enhanced executive function networks)
Large Canadian cohort study (n=28,000) found no significant bilingual advantage after controlling for immigration status and education level

cases.claim: Regenerative agriculture practices can sequester enough carbon to offset 10% of global agricultural emissions annually
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Cover cropping and no-till farming increase soil organic carbon by 0.3-0.5 tonnes C/ha/year in temperate climates; saturation occurs after 20-30 years
Global agricultural emissions are 10.5 GtCO2e/year; regenerative practices on 40% of cropland could sequester 0.5-1.5 GtCO2e/year (5-15% offset)
Permanence of soil carbon storage uncertain; drought or tillage can release stored carbon within 1-3 years

cases.claim: Social media use of more than 3 hours daily causes clinical depression in adolescents
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: US Surgeon General advisory cites association between 3+ hrs daily social media and doubled depression risk in teens; cross-sectional data, not causal
Randomized experiment: participants who reduced social media to 30 min/day for 3 weeks showed reduced loneliness and depression vs control group
evidence_packets.source: Journal of Social and Clinical Psychology

evidence_packets.summary: Longitudinal UK study (n=12,000) finds screen time explains only 0.4% of variance in adolescent wellbeing; sleep disruption is the mediating factor

cases.claim: Genetic testing for drug metabolism (pharmacogenomics) reduces adverse drug reactions by 30% compared to standard prescribing
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: PREPARE study (n=6,944): pharmacogenomics-guided prescribing reduced adverse drug reactions by 30% over 12 weeks vs standard care
Only 5 drug-gene pairs have strong clinical evidence; most prescribed drugs have no validated pharmacogenomic guidance
Implementation cost of $300-500 per patient; cost-effectiveness uncertain beyond high-risk polypharmacy populations

cases.claim: Chronic sleep restriction to 6 hours per night causes measurable cognitive decline equivalent to 2 nights of total sleep deprivation
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: 14-day sleep restriction study: 6-hr sleepers showed cumulative cognitive deficits equivalent to 48 hours total deprivation on PVT and working memory tasks
Neuroimaging shows chronic 6-hr sleepers have reduced prefrontal cortex activation and increased default mode network interference during tasks
Self-reported sleepiness plateaus after day 3, creating dangerous disconnect between perceived and actual impairment

cases.claim: Urban green infrastructure (green roofs, bioswales) can reduce urban heat island effect by 2-3 degrees Celsius at city scale
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Modeling study: 50% green roof coverage in Phoenix would reduce peak summer temperature by 1.5-2.0 C in densest urban areas
Singapore's green infrastructure program achieved 0.5-1.0 C local cooling but city-wide effect unmeasurable against background variability
Green infrastructure water requirements may be unsustainable in arid cities during heat waves when cooling is most needed

cases.claim: Fecal microbiota transplantation can effectively treat treatment-resistant depression
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Pilot RCT (n=60): FMT from healthy donors improved depression scores by 40% vs placebo at 8 weeks; effect attenuated by week 12
Gut-brain axis: specific Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium strains produce GABA and serotonin precursors; causal mechanism plausible but unproven in humans
FMT carries risks of antibiotic-resistant organism transmission; FDA safety alert issued after 2 patient deaths from unscreened donor stool

cases.claim: Room-temperature superconductors will be commercially viable within 10 years based on recent LK-99 claims
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: LK-99 replication attempts at 12 major labs universally failed to reproduce superconductivity; observed effects attributed to Cu2S impurity phase transitions
Current highest confirmed Tc is 250K at 170 GPa (hydrogen sulfide); room temperature at ambient pressure remains unachieved in peer-reviewed work
Materials science experts estimate 20-50 year timeline for practical room-temperature superconductors based on current theoretical understanding
